Params[3]: The search teams have looked through every corner in the lower-level car but haven't found anything.
It isn't until two in the morning the next day that Noan comes across a thread that seems as though it came off Field's scarf around the entrance to the ventilation duct in Storage 54 of Carriage G.

When people get into the storage and check the security footage, they notice that there is a range of areas the security camera fails to capture—because the camera is unable to turn properly with all the dust stuck at its rotating shaft.
The range of area isn't big at all—but still leaves enough room for a child to pass through easily.
Wow, nothing caught on tape. This ain't fishy at all, right?
What was the kid doin' here anyways?
Bancroft's team just left for a mission, and the kid might just have left with them.
Let me double-check with Rachel.
Through her terminal, Shauna again got a reply in the negative.
We've gone through everywhere already. How can someone just disappear like that?
Should we just wait until the team comes back tomorrow, then?
Wait, Field what?!
Bancroft gets back on the train at six in the morning.
He was still around when I left for training in the morning, but he was gone when I got back at 10 last night.
Was he out on the mission with you guys?
No, he wasn't. I kept my eye out for the goods the entire way because they cost an arm and a leg, and I didn't see him around.
Is it possible... that he was hiding among the goods?
We went through all the boxes already.
When did you do that?
We did it once before to minimize our stopover before we arrived at the station, and then a second time when we were delivering the goods.
...Wait.
Is it possible that he went missing right after the first time you went through the goods?
No way, because we ran a quick check over the goods once halfway through the mission.
A quick check, you said?
Right, because a few of our transport vehicles toppled over when we ran into some Corrupted on the way.
I mean, we did spend some time going around the place without the goods to divert their attention, but we didn't pick up on any abnormalities when we got back.
Did you lose anything this time?
No. We totally thought someone had their eye on this particular batch of goods because they were such gems, but we didn't really lose anything besides the few things that got damaged from the attack.
Could he still be on the train?
We went through everywhere in the lower level together. If he's still on the train, he's gotta be somewhere up there.
Yes. We went through everywhere, even all the ventilation ducts and the roof.
...Did you just say you did it all together?
Bancroft looks at them incredulously.
Right. I mean, not everyone was able to help, but a lot of people did give us a hand.
But this is all we found.
Noan hands the thread he found over to Bancroft.
I found it in one of the ventilation ducts, but I can't be sure if this is something that came off his scarf.
Bancroft rubs the thread for a few moments before he gives it a sniff—and that's when his face pales.
The texture and the smell of it... Yes, it's gotta be the scarf he wears that he got from my wife. I'm 100% sure.
Which ventilation duct did you find this in?
The one in Storage 54 of Carriage G.
Noan nods.
Why would he want to go there, though?
...Well...
So I see you're totally clueless, huh?
...Assad?
...What do you mean?
Please! We don't want to get kicked off the train!
Assad bursts out laughing as he mimics a child's voice.
(That's not something Field would ever say...!)
So he decided to tag along to see who's been stealing all the goods.
And bam—when he came out of the box he was hiding in, he caught Daddy red-handed!
But we didn't lose anything this time!
My, you sure you didn't leave your boy in City 074 for him to do the stealing for you?
Are you out of your mind?! I didn't even have time to see him because of this stupid long route you said you were going to take!
Assad smirks.
Oh, yes, we did take the long route—but so what? Are you gonna snitch to one of the "dickheads" now to get your little boy his meds?
W-why would I do that?!
How did he know my goods were in G54 anyways? Oh, I see. You told him my goods were there!
You should bring that question to your son because you're not going to believe what I say either way. But let's see—if he's not on the train, then he's gotta be in City 074 with all the goods, then.
Or are you just going to leave him there to die because he's such a burden?
With his lips trembling, Bancroft turns around to look at the door.
The countdown light on the frame is flashing—signaling that the train will be departing from City 074 in no time.
I'm going to look for him.
Wait, what?!
He has to be in the city. He's either at the base or where the Corrupted attacked us.
He grabs his protective suit and makes a dash for the door.

Wait, you haven't got your rewards yet. Since you didn't lose too many things this time, there's still food and a bottle of watered-down homemade rum for you after your monthly fine for the lost goods is taken care of. It's cold out there and you should bring some of them.
Barbra, bring them to him.
Here.
She produces a bag with bottles in it from behind the counter and tosses it toward Bancroft.
Thanks.
When are you coming back, Sir?
I probably won't be back for a while.
I'll be living out there with Field when I find him since there is no way the train is going to keep staying here just for me. We'll hop back on when the train comes back here again.
Can I go with you, then?
You can't. I'm going to go alone because it's much too dangerous out there.
But I still want to thank you and everyone else that helped look for Field...
Because... see, I never thought anyone would ever give me a hand after what I did.
Bancroft stands up and steps out of the closing door.
When Noan turns around, he sees Assad and Barbra—who's completely taken over his mother's place—smiling back at each other.

Ever since then, Noan has been asking around to see if anyone has seen Bancroft and Field—except they both seem to have disappeared off the face of the earth, gradually fading away from people's conversations.
Having a hard time letting go, Noan finishes the mechanical firefly Field left behind using the discarded mechanical parts he's gathered.
...Think this will do as a keepsake between us.
Training, walking alone in downpours, and jumping at every chance to look for Field—Noan grows used to these as time passes by.
The lower level has been the same hellhole it'd always been—but Noan knows that the fire in his heart will keep burning strong, so long as he still has a place among the people down here.
A year after Julie's death, Noan passes Rachel's test. He can now leave the train and join the Cargo Crew for missions.
Not a day has gone by that he stopped trying to bring about their collective dream and find his long-lost friend.
Living among people and experiencing their warmth and complexity first-hand, the boy grows up to be a well-rounded young man who now thinks twice before he acts.
He sees fireflies flying in the forest for the first when he's out on a delivery mission.
Before him are countless glowing spots on the ground that pave themselves into a path that leads into the dark of the night—and it's only then that it hits him that he's never forgotten a thing.

Be it his hot temper or all the heart-wrenching goodbyes he had to say—though toned down over the years by the warmth he's felt from all those around him, they've been with him all along and have now become an unseverable part of him.
Noan still dreams of the forest now every now and then.
And whenever he does, he'd see Field smiling among the fireflies, the same way he once hoped to see of his friend.
Where is he now? Is he living somewhere far away from ACA with Bancroft?
Or... is he long gone where no one would ever find him?
For years he's been looking for them—and for years they remain as elusive as the fireflies in his dream and the lullaby his mother used to sing...
Up will the sun rise above the horizon when away the night fades.
Summer!
Ugh...!
Jolting awake from what seemed to be an endless dream, Noan notices that he's grabbing Lithos' hand—as Lithos tries to hook a medical device up to him that he's never seen before.
Lithos? Wait, what was I...
We put you to sleep because your M.I.N.D. was a little unstable, and you just never woke up...
(Right, my name is "Noan"... and my M.I.N.D. went berserk and I went into a coma when I recalled my name and the reason I threw it away.)
Uhm, do you mind letting go?
Oops, sorry.
Letting go of Lithos' hand and looking embarrassed, Noan rubs his hand against his hair.
Were you going to hook this up to me just now?
This device is meant to treat M.I.N.D., and the cord fell off when they bumped into it in the middle of a fight... I was just trying to put it back on you.
...Did I wake up right after the cord fell off?
Wait, did you just say "in the middle of a fight"...?
Noan looks up—and sees that Talbot is having a shouting match with a few Constructs just a few meters away.
Just grow up already, kid! You'd be nothing more than Ascendants' partner in crime the moment you step out of here!
Why can't you just have more confidence in us?
Because confidence takes us nowhere! We're powerless against this disaster, and Ascendants are our only way out!
Shut your trap before I call the Purifying Force on you!
What in the world is going on over there...
It's all because of me... I put you to sleep without following the maintenance procedure...
I forgot to follow the standard procedure because I was on edge since I had a teammate that died after his M.I.N.D. went berserk...
You never woke up, and they all wanted to hold me accountable and were going to report this whole incident to the higher-ups, except the reception here at the base is dead now.
And people have been saying... that this is what happened to some of the other bases before they were attacked by Ascendants... which kind of puts me on edge now.
Why are you calling the Purifying Force on me when I'm just trying to save people?!
The Ascendant I ran into told me I'm good enough to pass the "filtering", and that he'd come to me if I survive his "test".
Why are we shunning this chance when it's right there in front of us?!
Best that we report this to the higher-ups, Talbot. Everyone here would be in dire danger if the Ascendants actually come here.
But this place won't be safe forever even if they don't come here. We still might get attacked at any time with all the threats still around us.
Talbot!
Sacrificing a few people means nothing if I get to have the power of an Ascendant—and I can save even more people with that.
You friggin' son of a...
Finally losing it, one of the Constructs swings a jab at Talbot.
As though personally getting punched in the face, Noan feels a burning pain.
...Ascendant...?
Hello, my beloved "traitors" who have relinquished your past. Vonnegut—the very power you came seeking—shall arrive in no time.
But before he is here, I can take and answer some of the frequently asked questions you might have.
That's Roland... So the rumor is true.
Will this do?
Yes, you may go back now.
Hold on, do you see who's in this medical chamber...
Don't sweat it. That's a special guest personally invited by "him", and he's at a much safer place than any of you.
Look, he's waking up.
A "special guest", you said...?

Params[1]: Ascendant, defecting Constructs... I remember them.

Params[3]: Are you taking him?
I am, because we'll be seeing even fewer humans the further down the road our plan goes—and I never wanted to see this planet deprived of all lives.
There will be Constructs and machines, but there are still countless talented humans trapped within their carnal shells that have yet to get their tickets.
Gemini caught him right when he fell off the train, the new weapon has made him immune to Punishing, and he's right here at City 210.
I say our new plan will be off to a good start with all these coincidences.

Params[1]: These are his memories from when he was going in and out of coma.
Someone brought him to an entirely white room when he was severely injured.
He didn't catch a good look of the person's face with all the light in his eyes, but he still remembers that weird-looking chair.

Params[3]: Boy, look at how damaged he is... and he's still alive...
How would you like him dealt with?
I want him to stay alive—but feel free to turn him into one of us your way if you so wish.
...Understood.
Where is Teasell? I thought you brought him back with you?
He's still in City 043 with the women.
He calls up the screen from his terminal and clicks on a live feed from the security camera.

The screen shows a half-demolished building—in which a long-haired young man now looks coldly at the people who were once his commandant and comrades as they provide the women with on-the-spot medical treatment.
I'll be keeping an eye out for Teasell... He doesn't have a place there among those people anymore, and that's how I know he'll come back here.
Is he the reason you came this time?
No, I actually came to get what I left with you here.
...Ready to use Cthylla's original, I gather?
No, we're going to run another experiment.

Params[1]: When he regains his memory, he has a hard time recognizing his body.
Did that happen after the surgery?
No... there seems to be more to it than that.
All the damage he sustains is reminding him that he's missing certain parts of his memory.

Params[3]: And there goes another trial. See, I told you that none of these defecting Constructs would ever make the cut.
You're only going to put Babylonia on edge letting him go around spreading the word however he wants.
And that's exactly what I want.
Oh, I see you're trying to bait them, huh?
Exactly, except I won't need you there for what I need to do after that.
So I'm getting laid off, I gather?
No, but I just thought I'd let him handle things here.
I'll bring you up to speed about Luna in the foreseeable future—and I don't suppose you'll still be around working for me once that happens, no?
...Well, well, well...
With a smirk on his face, Roland turns around to look at the person sitting on the chair.

I heard you didn't have a lot of Ascendants working for you, and that most of the Ascendants you have are either "trainees" like Cinderelik or "stand-ins" like yours truly—and that's why I thought there were "special" requirements in place that you wanted your Ascendants to meet.
But the kid has trouble controlling himself sometimes, and he's just so set on humans or the Constructs that failed the filtering.
I mean... you should have seen him when he came face to face with Gray Raven's ex-commandant Ravenge... Boy, was the kid like a cloying little puppy.
I see him as an empty shell without a soul.
What exactly are you trying to do placing so much trust in a lunatic like this?
I need there to still be a lot of people that can join our ranks in the new world after the filtering.
And his vision of the new world isn't different from mine—those that fail to pass the filtering might as well make themselves useful by being the Red Tide's food.
He believes that they'll be sleeping happily ever after in the Red Tide because the Red Tide will literally have dissolved all their pains from when they were still alive.
Which is why he loves the world in the Red Tide with all his heart as much as he does those twisted shards, and I have no reason to wake him up from his dream no matter what they really are.
Spoiling your kids never does them good.
How about you? Would you rather I stick my nose into what you do? Or do you just not believe that I'd steer clear of your way?
If you don't want to become one of my Ascendants, then all the work you do here and the information you receive are nothing more than a trade.
You already have what it takes to stand in the new world—and as long as you steer clear of the filtering, you can go anywhere you want and I won't stop you.
You won't stop me, but you're still going to keep an eye on me.
That's only appropriate. You're not one of us yet, after all.
Ha, not one of you... Your "special guest" is only suffering so much because he's not one of you yet either, isn't he?

Params[1]: That's right. I got these wounds... because I rejected someone.

Params[3]: Why didn't I agree?
I'll never be your accomplice.
Accomplice... So you think this is a crime?
What else? Do you think you're a hero? Everything you do is just reinforcing your Big Bad shtick. I won't be surprised if you show up as a black silhouette next time.
...This is the best way to make sure everyone lives.
Does becoming a shard of memories count as living to you?
They're certainly more alive than a completely rotten shell.
Why won't you understand? We share a similar past... and similar regrets. You should understand where I'm coming from.
I'll say it again—I understand why you've gone off the deep end, but I'll never agree with your actions.
Including reading my memories.
Mister didn't want me to get too aggressive—it doesn't matter to him whether you become one of us.
But I must admit being intrigued by you after I saw your past.
Not to mention that I made you... You carry my mark, unlike those regular Constructs. You're an "anomaly," and you can never get rid of that no matter how far you run.
If you leave me, you'll slowly lose control of yourself until you become a monster that hurts other people before they decide to hunt you down.
That's why you haven't killed me yet, isn't it?
That's right. Even dismissing the fact that I'm intrigued by your past, it's only natural that a creator is attached to their creation, right?
...I'd hate to break you that quickly.
The blurred figure sighs, slowly approaching Noan.
...But I can't convince you however hard I try, can I?
I'm sorry. Forgive me... then forget all of this. We'll start again, and we'll make up then.
Does it hurt? I'm sorry... but naughty children need to be disciplined.
...You... Cough... cough...

Params[1]: Noan feels a sharp pain in his chest before everything fades to black.
His memories melt away into the chaos with his injuries. Only now does he remember that... he is the one involved with the Ascendants.

Params[3]: I was prepared for the fact that I'm probably one of those righteous super friends, but I wasn't expecting to be someone the Ascendants invited.
...To have something like this happen to a regular guy is as absurd as reading the start of a manga.
If you leave me, you'll slowly lose control of yourself until you become a monster that hurts other people.
At least I haven't lost control for now...
What now? "Start again"... Could that person be lurking nearby?
Lost in thought, Noan finally looks up to find everyone rushing outside in disarray.
Large number of Corrupted approaching!
How far away?
Several hundred meters. Where are the guards?!
****! Where is everyone?!
The alarm isn't triggered either. What is going on?!
...It can't be...
The Ascendant... Is he finally coming?
Finally?! Have you lost your mind?! There are still a lot of patients in there!
Ascendant...?!
I won't run away. Please let me fight with you!
I'm coming with you too!
Noan steps out of the medical center.
